column4: hey, I'd like to set up a proxy on my server so I can keep my traffic logged through my server and not from my school
is it possible to set up a proxy server in ubuntu?
what sort of proxy?
I need to proxy port 80 so I can keep all my traffic logged from the server and not from the school
squid
it's telling me to "Set 'visible_hostname'"
where? in the .conf?
you need to edit the configuration file. it will be in /etc somewhere and end in .conf
I think I'd rather set up a vpn
what exactly are you trying to do?
then, set up an ssh tunnel
just google for ssh tunnel. there are hundreds of simple tutorials.
I'm using a windows computer, there are no free ssh clients out there for windows afaik
putty
yes
think about it very hard. it's confusing at first, but it will soon snap into place ;)
I see nothing on tunneling port 80 through ssh putty agh, I'm gonna cry
just open up putty, and set up a tunnel under the profile or whatever. also, i don't recommend you stay with putty, openssh is way superior.
openssh isn't for windows
there is a windows client
since i last checked
did you get it working?
startx , i think. but you may have to do a bit of other magic i'm unaware of...
